item.title: CoD: Black Ops 6 - Best Ranked Play Loadouts
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Ranked Play Loadouts For Black Ops 6
    • XM4
    • AMES 85
    • Jackal PDW
  • Best Perks & Equipment For Black Ops 6 Ranked Play

Since 2022, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 developer Treyarch has spearheaded the development of Call of Duty 's Ranked Play, a competitive game mode complete with its own set of rules and regulations matching what Esports pros use in the Call of Duty League (CDL). Compared to the standard multiplayer arsenal, Ranked Play contains significantly less weaponry, making loadout selection key in order to achieve success.

With only a handful of guns to choose from, building a loadout to suit all styles of play can be a tricky task. For those struggling, here are the best Black Ops 6 Ranked Play loadouts to use in close-quarters, mid-range, and long-distance duels.

Best Ranked Play Loadouts For Black Ops 6

These loadouts are based on the official restrictions created by Treyarch in order to replicate the same rules the very best players in the world use on the big stage. Pro players have unofficially agreed not to use some weaponry, but they are still available in Black Ops 6 Ranked Play for the time being.

XM4

One weapon that forms part of the gentlemen's agreement is the XM4 assault rifle. As it's still allowed in the current set of rules, the rifle excels in mid-range combat thanks to its excellent rate of fire and low recoil. This particular build utilizes the Gunfighter Wildcard, giving players a total of eight attachment slots to fill:

  • Optic : Kelper Microflex
  • Muzzle : Ported Compensator
  • Barrel : Reinforced Barrel
  • Underbarrel : Vertical Foregrip
  • Rear Grip : Commando Grip
  • Stock : Balanced Stock
  • Fire Mod : 5.56 NATO Overpressured

AMES 85

For those wanting an alternative to the XM4 or to adhere to the gentlemen's agreement, the AMES 85 is another viable assault rifle that has already cemented itself within the competitive Black Ops 6 meta. This build capitalizes on the rifle's strong mobility, enabling players to provide essential support to the submachine gunners getting up close and personal with the opposition:

  • Optic : Kelper Microflex
  • Muzzle : Ported Compensator
  • Barrel : Reinforced Barrel
  • Underbarrel : Vertical Foregrip
  • Rear Grip : Commando Grip
  • Stock : Balanced Stock
  • Fire Mod : Recoil Springs

Jackal PDW

One weapon that has managed to withstand all weapon buffs and nerfs so far is the Jackal PDW submachine gun. The very best in the world are sticking with this particular SMG when there are huge amounts of money up for grabs, which means that it should work perfectly in Black Ops 6 Ranked Play. The most popular build maintains the Jackal PDW's high damage output and enhances mobility, making it the very best choice in those hectic close-quarters battles:

  • Muzzle : Compensator
  • Barrel : Reinforced Barrel
  • Underbarrel : Ranger Foregrip
  • Rear Grip : Ergonomic Grip
  • Stock : Balanced Stock

Best Perks & Equipment For Black Ops 6 Ranked Play

Once the strongest attachment combinations are ready for battle, picking the right the right Perks and Equipment is the next step before starting the climb through each skill division. Below are the best ones for competitive action:

  • Perk 1 : Ninja
  • Perk 2 : Fast Hands
  • Perk 3 : Double Time
  • Wildcard : Gunfighter
  • Lethal : Frag or Semtex
  • Tactical : Concussion
  • Field Upgrade : Trophy System

Ninja is essential for moving around the map without footstep audio drawing the opposition to the location of teammates. Fast Hands is another excellent choice thanks to the faster weapon swap speed, enabling players to switch to their pistol in scenarios where reloading isn't an option.

The third and final Perk is Double Time, which doubles the length of Tac Sprint, giving players the fastest ways of moving around the battlefield. Being paired with the Knife melee weapon makes it very easy to reach specific areas of the map before enemies have a chance to get there.

The best Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Ranked Play loadouts are bound to change as Treyarch adjusts weapon performance alongside the rules and restrictions. As such, this guide will be updated to include new builds as the cycle progresses and the meta evolves.

item.title: Dragon Quest 3 Remake: Skyfell Tower Walkthrough (Robbin 'Ood)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Reach Robbin 'Ood and Skyfell Tower in Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Skyfell Tower Walkthrough First Floor 1F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Second Floor 2F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Third Floor 3F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Fourth Floor 4F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Final Floors 5F & 6F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • How to Beat Robbin 'Ood in Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • All Enemies in Skyfell Tower – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Dragpn Quest 3 Remake features several dungeons for players to explore. While it's not technically the first dungeon in the game, players will find that Skyfell Tower feel like the first traditional dungeon experience, complete with final boss fight. The boss, Robbin 'Ood, is one of the funniest enemies in the game, and truly showcases the unique charm that makes Dragon Quest 3 such a beloved JRPG. In this guide, we will present a complete walkthrough of Skyfell Tower, including where to find every treasure in the dungeon.

How to Reach Robbin 'Ood and Skyfell Tower in Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Once you've completed Dreamer's Tower and collected the Thief's Key in Dragon Quest 3 Remake , your next task will be to collect the King's Crown from Robbin 'Ood, a notorious thief who lives in the forest northwest of Romaria. Robbin 'Ood is located in Skyfell Tower, a dungeon very similar to Dreamer's Tower. In many ways, you could say that Skyfell Tower is technically the game's first real dungeon, because it has a true boss in Robbin 'ood.

To reach Skyfell Tower, you'll first need to head north from Romaria to the town of Khoryv . Once you've made it to Khoryv, make sure to rest, then head directly west, then down the peninsula. You should see a yellow circle marking the tower's location.

Skyfell Tower Walkthrough First Floor 1F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Skyfell Tower 1F Main Path:

When you first arrive at the tower, try to enter the west side of the structure. You'll spend less time looking at the map, you'll see that there is only one way up to the second floor.

On the first floor, you'll encounter the following enemies:

  • Restless Armor
  • Crabid
  • Scornet
  • Vlady
  • Cumaulus
  • Healslime ( Summoned as backup by Restless Armor )

The Restless Armor seems like the biggest threat outside the main monsters you face. It's a good plan to go after them first. Vlady will drain your MP, which can be devastating at early levels. Crabid s can – and often will – call in backup. They pack a serious punch, and you may not have the spells to hit their weak points. They can be a real problem, so don't let them get out of hand. Having a character with a whip or boomerang can help.

There are several Treasure Chests on the first floor. See their locations below.

All Treasure on Skyfell Tower 1F:

There are two treasure locations on floor 1F.

  • Treasure 1: Chain Sickle
  • Barrel 1: Magic Water

Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Second Floor 2F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Skyfell Tower 2F Main Path:

When you reach the second floor and open the map, you'll see that the stairs that lead to 3F are in the northeast corner of the floor. You'll have to follow the northern wall around the outer edge of the tower, then make your way to the stairs.

If you head to the chamber in the southeast corner of the second floor, you'll find Bub, a friendly Bubble Slime hiding behind one of the pedestals sitting in front of the statue. You have to get really close to the pedestal on the right for Bub to show themselves.

There are two new enemies we encountered on 2F:

  • Illerpillar
  • Funghoul

All Treasure on Skyfell Tower 2F:

  • Chest 1: Wizard Staff (in same chamber as Bub, southeast corner)
  • Barrel 1: Seed of Defence
  • Barrel 2: 48 Gold Coins

Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Third Floor 3F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Skyfell Tower 3F Main Path:

From the top of the stairs that lead to 3F, you can look at the map and see you have to make it all the way around the outer edge to reach the stairs that lead to the fourth floor. The first large chamber you'll pass on the right has a single treasure chest in the southwestern corner.

There is a single NPC in the second, smaller chamber that sits in the center of the path that leads around the tower to the final staircase. He will explain the history of the tower, and doesn't provide much in the way of help. There are two treasure pots along the north wall of the same chamber.

All Treasure on Skyfell Tower 3F:

  • Chest 1: Bronze Shield
  • Pot 1: Gold Coin
  • Pot 2: Strong Medicine

Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Fourth Floor 4F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Skyfell Tower 4F Main Path:

When you reach the fourth floor of Skyfell Tower, you'll find that it's partially made up of a rooftop area, as well as a smaller indoor area. There are two pots found on the rooftop area. Inside, you'll find where the bandits have been storing much of their loot. Among the pile, you'll find two treasure chests and a pot . You'll still have to deal with random encounters, so try and gather the treasure and make your way to the fifth floor as quickly as you can.

All Treasure on Skyfell Tower 4F:

There are five treasure locations on the fourth floor of Skyfell Tower:

Outside:

  • Pot 1: Pouch of Musk
  • Pot 2: 33 Gold Coins

Inside:

  • Pot 3: Phial of Magic Water
  • Chest 1: Mini-Medal
  • Chest 2: Prayer Ring

Skyfell Tower Walkthrough Final Floors 5F & 6F – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Skyfell Tower 5F & 6F Main Path:

When you reach the top of the spiral stairs that lead to the fifth floor of Skyfell Tower, you'll immediately be spotted by Robbin 'Ood's underlings. They will quickly run up the stairs to tell their boss. Follow them up the stairs, as there is no treasure on 5F, and you want to avoid any more encounters.

When you reach the sixth floor, you'll find Robbin 'Ood and his three Robbin 'Oodlums waiting for you. As you approach, a trap door will open under you. Don't fret, this will only drop you on the fourth floor. Robbin 'Ood jumps out the eastern window to the 4F rooftop. We don't know for certain if you can simply head outside to find Robbin 'Ood. We went up to 5F and jumped out the eastern window, which put us in the boss encounter right away.

All Treasure on Skyfell Tower 6F:

There are two treasure chests behind Robbin 'Ood, which can only be opened after you finish the boss encounter.

  • Chest 1: Skull Ring
  • Chest 2: Ruby Wristband

How to Beat Robbin 'Ood in Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Robbin 'Ood Main Strategy:

This can be a difficult fight for two reasons: you must climb the tower before the fight, and you will not have access to the strongest spells and abilities this early in the game.

We fought Robbin 'Ood at level 13, with the rest of the party all about the same. And while it is certainly possible to get through the fight with all four party members alive, we finished the fight with one member dead. Unfortunately, this meant that one member did not receive the XP from the fight. However, it is not worth fighting over and over again to ensure everyone survives. Not long after this fight, you will find locations that will make up any lost XP extremely quickly.

Our strategy in this fight was to take out Robbin ;Ood first. Both he and the Robbin' Oodlums are weak to Zap, but we did not have that spell unlocked yet, so we focused on Robbin 'Ood first with his two main weaknesses: Fire and Wind.

By this time, the Hero should have Fire Slash , and possibly Gust Slash . In this case, the Fire Slash seems to do more damage. If you have a Mage , use Frizz. If you have a Priest, use Woosh. If you have a Thief , use Propellar Blade. This was our main strategy for taking out Robbin 'Ood as fast as possible. Any attack with Wind or Fire is your best bet.

Robbin 'Ood's attacks are extremely strong, and can take out many early game party members within a couple of hits. Because of this, it is highly recommended that you bring a Priest for healing, or make sure you are stocked up with Medicinal Herbs in your party's personal inventories.

IN the fight with Robbin 'Ood, and any fight generally, do not rush . It is worth it to use a party member's (or multiple members') turn for healing. It is much better than wasting the entire encounter focusing just on attacks and then dying near the end.

Once you have Robbin' Ood down to extremely low health, which is signified by the darker color of his name, you can begin focusing one or two party members' attacks on the Robbin 'Oodlums. If you have a boomerang or whip-wielding character, that is a good option as they can attack all three at once. Also, use any multi-enemy spells you can, such as Sizzle .

Collect the King's Crown:

Once Robbin 'Ood is defeated, he will beg you to let him go. We chose to set him free, but it does not seem to matter much to the overall game. You will encounter Robbin 'Ood again at the Kidnapper's Cave , no matter which you select. Afterward, the King's Crown will be waiting for you to pick it up.

Return the crown to the King of Romaria whenever you want. You will briefly become King or Queen yourself. When you are ready to give it up, find the King in the stands at the Monster Arena, and he'll take the crown back, and you may continue your journey.

All Enemies in Skyfell Tower – Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Enemy Name

Weakness

Restless Armor

Electricity

Crabid

Ice

Scornet

Wind

Vlady

Wind

Cumaulus

Wind

Funghoul

Fire

Illerpillar

TBD

Healslime

Fire

Robbin 'Oodlum

Electricity

Robbin 'Ood

Fire, Wind

item.title: Dragon Age The Veilguard: 10 Rogue Skills With The Highest Damage
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Veil Ranger specialization in Dragon Age: The Veilguard focuses on bow abilities like Storm's Path, dealing electricity damage.
  • Lightning Quiver fires electric arrows randomly, hitting multiple foes, increasing damage output.
  • Saboteur specialization includes Fortune's Turret, a deployable turret exploding for extra damage.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard changed combat for the franchise, with it becoming far more action-based. This also meant the skills and abilities available to the three classes in Dragon Age were also changed to better suit its combat. Rogue is one of the three classes that has always been available to players, with the agile class having both physical and elemental skills available for it.

Players who are looking for the best Rogue skills that do the highest amount of damage should look no further than these options for creating a lethal Rook that is sure to be able to hold their own when taking on the Blighted gods Elgar'nan and Ghilan'nain.

10 Storm's Path

Damages All Foes In An Area With Electricity

  • Type: Area, Projectile
  • Cost: One circle of Adrenaline

Veil Ranger is an entirely new specialization for Rogues that was introduced in Dragon Age: The Veilguard. This specialization focuses heavily on the bow, and, therefore, many of the abilities available to the player also involve using the bow.

Storm's Path shoots electricity into an area that electrocutes all foes that are hit by it in a blast. Not only does this do a decent amount of damage from afar, but Storm's Path can also be used to detonate Overwhelm, which also deals damage in an area as it causes the foe it hits to explode.

9 Lightning Quiver

Pepper Enemies With Electric Arrows

  • Type: Projectile, Control
  • Cost: One circle of Adrenaline

On the way to the Veil Ranger specialization, there are other electric-themed abilities for the player to invest their points in. Lightning Quiver is another brilliant Projectile option for players who are looking for skills that do the highest amount of damage, not only due to the amount of damage it does but also due to it firing seven arrows randomly at foes.

Although the randomness may be an issue for some players, being able to fire into a group of enemies from afar and being sure that a good majority of them will be hit means players can damage multiple foes with one ability.

8 Lightning Flask

Shock And Push Enemies Away

  • Type: Duration, Control
  • Cost: One circle of Adrenaline

Continuing to explore the Rogue abilities that deal electricity damage, the Lightning Flask is another worthwhile option for players to make the most of, and a familiar ability that players may remember from Dragon Age: Inquisition .

While similar to the Flask of Lightning in name, players that throw down this glass bottle of elemental damage will surround themselves with electricity that not only explodes to unleash a storm but also applies Shocked on the player's opponents. By applying Shocked to an enemy, they don't only receive more damage over time, but also gradually gain more stagger too.

7 Explosive Daggers

Daggers Stick To And Explode Foes

  • Type: Projectile, Duration
  • Cost: One circle of Adrenaline

While the Rogue class does have an assortment of elemental damage abilities, players are more likely to be using skills that deal immense physical damage to their opponents instead. One great option that players may be interested in always having available to use is Explosive Daggers.

These sticky explosive daggers are perfect for any Rogue, no matter the build. Not only does this Rogue skill apply the Sundered affliction to enemies, which can then be detonated by a party member for more damage, even on its own, the explosive daggers are sure to detonate slowly with incredible physical damage.

6 A Thousand Cuts

Slice And Dice With Necrotic Damage

  • Type: Strike, Control
  • Cost: One circle of Adrenaline

Duelist is a returning specialization in Dragon Age: The Veilguard . However, since its original appearance in Dragon Age: Origins , this Antivan Crow-themed specialization has changed quite a lot.

Instead of simply focusing on melee combat, which the player would assume would make the abilities do physical damage, the assassin faction has instead made the most of poison with skills like A Thousand Cuts dominating all foes ahead of the player with necrotic damage. Players hit for a total of sixteen times ahead of them, which has the potential to deal a significant amount of damage if the slicing and dicing tactic doesn't push them out of the way.

5 Fortune's Turret

Another Friend That Shoots Enemies

  • Type: Duration, Tool
  • Cooldown: 60 seconds

On the opposite side of the skill page is the third and final specialization available to Rogues, the Saboteur. This specialization has some of the best abilities available, especially for a player who wishes to mix up their combat with both ranged and melee attacks.

However, these abilities also give players extra help, like Fortune's Turret, which the player can freely place without needing to use Adrenaline. This turret will then continuously attack nearby enemies. After it has done its job, the turret then explodes in a final burst of damage.

4 Murder Of Crows

Quickly Dispatch Enemies Using Necrotic Damage

  • Type: N/A
  • Cooldown: N/A

Returning to the Duelist specialization, the ultimates that are available are by far the best way for players to deal a high amount of damage. Although Murder of Crows may be one of the weaker ultimates available to Rogues, it still deals a decent amount of damage to make this specialization worthwhile, especially for any player focusing on a melee build.

Murder of Crows attacks all enemies in an area with Necrotic damage that quickly dashes between them. It then concludes with one final explosion of necrotic damage for any foe that still finds themselves trapped within the strike area.

3 Concussive Barrage

Bombs That Stagger Opponents

  • Type: N/A
  • Cooldown: N/A

Alongside the ultimates given to players depending on the specialization they have chosen, Concussive Barrage is the ultimate that the Rogue has access to from the start and is another great skill option that does the highest amount of damage.

Not only is Concussive Barrage perfect for players looking to do a lot of physical damage, but it's also a brilliant option for players looking to create a stagger build, as each explosion of the bombs does a high amount of stagger alongside its usual damage. This means after the ultimate is over, players will likely have multiple takedowns to complete.

2 Twin Gifts Of Arlathan

An Ultimate That Bounces Between Enemies, Electrocuting Them

  • Type: N/A
  • Cooldown: N/A

Using the artifacts found around the Arlathan Forest, Twin Gifts of Arlathan is another Rogue ultimate that damages a group of enemies easily with electricity damage. The player throws out two electric gizmos that bounce between their foes, dealing electric damage continuously.

This is another great option for Rogues who have decided to use the bow most of all, as this ultimate allows the player to still stay away from danger and then throw their ultimate into a large group of enemies. While Twin Gifts of Arlathan can't cause the Shocked affliction like other Veil Ranger abilities, it is still a great option for players hoping to kill foes quickly.

1 Fortune's Fury

Players Are Given A Canon To Shoot Foes With

  • Type: N/A
  • Cooldown: N/A

Out of all the available skills for the Rogue in Dragon Age: The Veilguard, one of the best skills with the highest damage is the Saboteur ultimate of Fortune's Fury. This ultimate is by far the best for Rogue, not just because of its high physical damage, but also because of how cool it looks.

When using Fortune's Fury, players whip out an expendable weapon that looks like a canon, which then repeatedly shoots ammunition. Once the ultimate is over, the player is then able to throw the weapon at enemies in one final explosion. This means players can do even more damage with Fortune's Fury if they aim for critical rather than just regular shots.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How To Unlock Merida (A New Chapter Walkthrough)
item.description:
Unlike other characters where you must complete many prerequisites to unlock them as villagers, Merida is quite simple as she only needs one quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley . The Brave character is the first one you get to meet upon landing in Storybook Vale.

The first step is to unlock the Royal Net tool in Disney Dreamlight Valley , as it’s a crucial tool that will be heavily used in the Storybook Vale. After completing the quest and acquiring the royal tool, players can trigger the next quest to unlock Merida as a villager.

How To Unlock Merida In Disney Dreamlight Valley

After completing the Welcome to the Storybook Vale quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley , you will trigger A New Chapter quest that unlocks Merida after completing it. Merida’s goal in this mission is to restore the Bind to some of its former glory and make it habitable.

The first thing she asks you to do is to unlock the Bind area, which costs 500 Story Magic. You can collect Story Magic by completing tasks in the Storybook Duties and Storybook Vale. Once the Wall of Ink is removed, speak with Merida in the Bind to find out that she wants you to remove some Inkies and catch some Snippets.

Later on, Goofy and Scrooge McDuck arrive at Storybook Vale and Merida urges you to help them open their shops. To help both characters in Disney Dreamlight Valley , make sure to catch three fish or seafood of any kind and mine 10 gems or minerals from mining rocks. Use Star Coins to unlock the shops in the Bind.

Finally, Merida takes you to a secret room that only Dreamers can open. Head inside to collect the clue left by Aurora and tell Merida about it. To access what is behind the wall in Aurora’s room, interact with the lamp to the left, then use the Royal Net to rotate the wheel, thus activating the water fountains.

The last step is to place Merida’s house foundation and pay 5,000 Star Coins to McDuck to build her house. After that, the A New Chapter quest is complete, and the Brave character becomes available as a villager.

item.title: Farming Simulator 25: How To Sell Properties
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Sell Properties And Structures
  • How To Sell Land

Players will buy and sell properties, livestock, and land on a regular basis. One of the best ways to grow in Farming Simulator 25 is to make regular investments within the business to expand and run a successful farm. During the game's early stages, players may decide to invest in cheaper properties and upgrade to more expensive ones later.

Selling these cheaper starter properties can help players accumulate some extra funds when it comes time to upgrade. This guide will go through how to sell properties in Farming Simulator 25 and give a few tips regarding buying and selling structures.

How To Sell Properties And Structures

Provided that you own the land, then you can sell structures and properties located within the area. The button to enter build mode will depend on your platform. If you are on a PC, then it's left shift + P to open the build menu. To check the buttons, head to settings, game settings, and controls. Here you can see what each button does, this includes the button to enter build mode.

Once you are in build mode, you can move around your farm from above and select any building or structure located within your land to sell. Selling some of the more pointless structures like unwanted sheds and barns is a good way to make some extra money on day one. Since your farm does come with a few buildings by default, it's possible to make a pretty decent amount of money for virtually zero effort. Since you can purchase and place down structures whenever you like, there's no real downside to selling some of your extra items early on for some quick cash.

How To Sell Land

You can sell land in the map menu. Simply pull up the map, hover over any land that you own, and then select the option to sell. While you will buy and sell land fairly regularly later on in your playthrough, you will probably want to keep as much land as you can during the early stages of the game.

One great way to make money by selling land is to purchase farmland that has crops that are ready to be harvested. Purchase the land, harvest the crops, and then sell the land to get all your money back. This method can be a pretty lucrative moneymaker as there's very little risk involved since you aren't actually growing the crops themselves.
